content.html:
Cool Down Activity

The function \(W\) gives the temperature, in degrees Fahrenheit, of a pot of water on a stove \(t\) minutes after the stove is turned on. After 30 minutes, the pot is taken off the stove.

The graph of the function is shown.


  1. Is 250 in the range of function \(W\)? Explain how you know.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answers:

No, 250 is not in the range. The highest temperature is 212 degrees Fahrenheit.



  1. Describe the range of the function.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answers:

The range is all values between 75 and 212, the lowest and the highest temperature; \(75\leq y\leq212.\)



  1. Does \(W(t)=0\) have a solution? Explain how you know.

Enter your answer here:

Compare your answers:

No, a solution to this equation would be the time when the temperature is 0 degrees Fahrenheit, which is never the case.
